proposals.example: How far had Morino lived in America? (far->long)
proposals.gesture: Move the cursor to the end of far with the index of the right hand, then delete with the keyboard, then typing
proposals.reasons: I love my keyboard, thus i would delete with it
proposals.notes: She thinks there could be other ways to do it, but because i love my keyboard, i would use it, mine was a bit complicated

proposals.example: How long have her had this fever? (have her -> has she)
proposals.gesture: Use both indices, left and right, then select, then just typing
proposals.reasons: I will use my right hand because I am right handed. It is not conflicting with sliding the cursor.

proposals.gesture: Use both indices to select, then move both hands to move the text
proposals.reasons: I will use both indices, and then select the way is used before, it is easier

proposals.example: He likes to eat healthy when visiting visiting restaurants
proposals.gesture: Select with both indices, then move the index of the right hand down to delete it
proposals.reasons: I would use my right index because it comes naturally

proposals.gesture: (similar to reoder group)Select it with two indices, then just move the hand to reoder it
proposals.reasons: Because it is similar in selection and reorder group

proposals.example: What took you so long so long
proposals.gesture: (Similar to deleteSingle) Select with both indices, then move the right hand index down to delete it
proposals.reasons: It is easy and intuitive, i always use the same moves

proposals.example: Tom is traveling to Berlin week (next)
proposals.gesture: Use the index of the left hand to move the cursor and then just typing

comments: I believe consistency will be very important, same gestures for same things, like selection. Nothing too complicated, like going crazy with my hands, it is very cool
